articles.title: Octopus-inspired glove lets you manipulate objects underwater
articles.description: A glove with artificial suckers inspired by those found on octopuses allows people to securely grip delicate objects underwater, and the technology could be added to robots in future
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
This “octa-glove” lets you pick up objects using octopus-like suckers
Michael Bartlett
Artificial suckers inspired by those of an octopus could allow robots to delicately grasp … [+1970 chars]

articles.title: Robot that can perceive its body has self-awareness, claim researchers
articles.description: The team claims to have given a robot self-awareness of its location in physical space, but others are sceptical
articles.content:
By Chris Stokel-Walker
A robot has been argued to have developed an awareness of its surroundings
Chen, Lipson, Nisselson, Qin/Columbia Engineering

articles.title: Forests are becoming less resilient because of climate change
articles.description: An analysis of two decades of satellite data shows that forests in arid, tropical and temperate regions are becoming less able to bounce back after events such as drought and logging
articles.content:
By Adam Vaughan
A pine forest near Auckland, New Zealand
Tahreer Photography/Getty Images
Climate change has been linked with a widespread decline in the ability of many of the worlds forests to b… [+2972 chars]

articles.title: Starfish embryos form weird 'living crystal' we have never seen before
articles.description: Whilst studying how starfish embryos swim, researchers observed a previously unseen phenomenon where the embryos clumped together into a honeycomb pattern near the surface of the water
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
Starfish embryos clump together into a living crystal
Fakhri et al.
Starfish embryos can organise themselves into large, oscillating crystals at the surface of water. … [+455 chars]

articles.title: Moving turtle eggs to protect them disrupts brain development
articles.description: Moving sea turtle eggs to protect them comes with its own risks, as the resulting hatchlings tend to be less well-developed than those that remain in their original location
articles.content:
By Elizabeth Preston
An olive ridley turtle leaving its egg
Photo by Sumit Sanyal/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images

articles.title: Efforts to regulate 'killer robots' are threatened by war in Ukraine
articles.description: International efforts to legally control the use of "killer robots" are faltering because of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine

articles.title: Penguins adapt their accents to sound more like their friends
articles.description: African penguins modify their calls to sound more similar to their partners and colony mates over time, showing a form of vocal learning known in only a few animals
articles.content:

African penguins at Boulders Beach in South Africa
RapidEye/Getty Images

articles.title: James Webb Space Telescope team quietly releases a picture of Jupiter
articles.description: On top of the first high-resolution science images that NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope team just released, there was also a picture of Jupiter hidden in a document about telescope testing

The James Webb Space Telescope imaged Jupiter and three of its moons during testing

articles.title: Modified pig hearts transplanted into dead people kept on life support
articles.description: Researchers at NYU have successfully transplanted two genetically modified pig hearts into recently deceased humans who were kept on ventilators.
